WorkItem.Description:
What I've done :

Using VS2013 under Win7 created new MVC4 project from default template.

Compiled - works like a charm.

Then executed in Package Manager Console : "Install-Package RazorEngine"


Attempting to resolve dependency 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor (â‰¥ 3.0.0)'.
Installing 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 3.0.0'.
You are downloading Microsoft.AspNet.Razor from Microsoft, the license agreement to which is available at http://www.microsoft.com/web/webpi/eula/aspnetcomponent_rtw_ENU.htm. Check the package for additional dependencies, which may come with their own license agreement(s). Your use of the package and dependencies constitutes your acceptance of their license agreements. If you do not accept the license agreement(s), then delete the relevant components from your device.
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 3.0.0'.
Installing 'RazorEngine 3.4.0'.
Successfully installed 'RazorEngine 3.4.0'.
Removing 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 2.0.30506.0' from MvcApplication1.
Successfully removed 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 2.0.30506.0' from MvcApplication1.
Adding 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 3.0.0' to MvcApplication1.
Successfully added 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 3.0.0' to MvcApplication1.
Adding 'RazorEngine 3.4.0' to MvcApplication1.
Successfully added 'RazorEngine 3.4.0' to MvcApplication1.
Uninstalling 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 2.0.30506.0'.
Successfully uninstalled 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 2.0.30506.0'.



Compiled again project and ... - got this error with message

Inheritance security rules violated by type: 'System.Web.WebPages.Razor.WebPageRazorHost'. Derived types must either match the security accessibility of the base type or be less accessible.



Any ideas what I'm doing wrong ?

Have attached  project source
WorkItem.Summary: Inheritance security rules violated by type: 'System.Web.WebPages.Razor.WebPageRazorHost'. Derived types must either match the security accessibility of the base type or be less accessible.

Comments.Message:
I had similar issue.
Removing the reference to the "System.web.Razor" under the assembly bindings in your web.config fixed it for me
Had similar problem just adding jquery-ui to an upgraded MVC3 -> MVC4 conversion with nuget package manager console. The reference to System.web.Razor was added in again reintroducing the problem.
